verses.verse: But <WG1161> speak <WG2980> thou <WG4771> the things which <WG3739> befit <WG4241> the sound <WG5198> doctrine <WG1319>:
that <WG1511> aged men <WG4246> be <WG1511> temperate <WG4998>, grave <WG4586>, sober-minded <WG4998>, sound <WG5198> in faith <WG4102>, in love <WG26>, in patience <WG5281>:

that <WG3361> aged women <WG4247> likewise <WG5615> be reverent <WG2412> in <WG1722> demeanor <WG2688>, not <WG3361> slanderers <WG1228> nor <WG3361> enslaved <WG1402> to much <WG4183> wine <WG3631>, teachers of that which is good <WG2567>;
that <WG2443> they may train <WG4994> the young women3501, 1511, 4994 to love their husbands <WG5362>, to love their children <WG5388>,

to be sober-minded <WG4998>, chaste <WG53>, workers at home <WG3626>, kind <WG18>, being in subjection <WG5293> to their own <WG2398> husbands <WG435>, that <WG2443> the word <WG3056> of God <WG2316> be <WG987> not <WG3361> blasphemed <WG987>:
the younger men <WG3501> likewise <WG5615> exhort <WG3870> to be sober-minded <WG4993>:

in <WG4012> all things <WG3956> showing <WG3930> thyself <WG4572> an ensample <WG5179> of good <WG2570> works <WG2041>; in <WG1722> thy doctrine <WG1319> showing uncorruptness <WG90>, <WG861> gravity <WG4587>,

sound <WG5199> speech <WG3056>, that cannot be condemned <WG176>; that <WG2443> he that is <WG3588> of <WG1537> the contrary part <WG1727> may be ashamed <WG1788>, having <WG2192> no <WG3367> evil thing <WG5337> to say <WG3004> of <WG4012> us <WG5216>.

Exhort servants <WG1401> to be in subjection <WG5293> to their own <WG2398> masters <WG1203>, and to <WG1511> be well-pleasing <WG2101> to them in <WG1722> all <WG3956> things <WG3361>; not gainsaying <WG483>;

not <WG3361> purloining <WG3557>, but <WG235> showing <WG1731> all <WG3956> good <WG18> fidelity <WG4102>; that <WG2443> they may adorn <WG2885> the doctrine <WG1319> of God <WG2316> our <WG2257> Saviour <WG4990> in <WG1722> all things <WG3956>.
For <WG1063> the grace <WG5485> of God <WG2316> hath appeared <WG2014>, bringing <WG3588> salvation <WG4992> to all <WG3956> men <WG444>,

instructing <WG3811> us <WG2248>, to the intent that <WG2443>, denying <WG720> ungodliness <WG763> and <WG2532> worldly <WG2886> lusts <WG1939>, we should live <WG2198> soberly <WG4996> and righteously <WG1346> and <WG2532> godly <WG2153> in <WG1722> this <WG3588> present <WG3568> world <WG165>;

looking for <WG4327> the <WG3588> blessed <WG3107> hope <WG1680> and <WG2532> appearing <WG2015> of the glory <WG1391> of the great <WG3173> God <WG2316> and <WG2532> our <WG2257> Saviour <WG4990> Jesus <WG2424> Christ <WG5547>;

who <WG3739> gave <WG1325> himself <WG1438> for <WG5228> us <WG2257>, that <WG2443> he might redeem <WG3084> us <WG2248> from <WG575> all <WG3956> iniquity <WG458>, and <WG2532> purify <WG2511> unto himself <WG1438> a people <WG2992> for his own possession <WG4041>, zealous <WG2207> of good <WG2570> works <WG2041>.

These things <WG5023> speak <WG2980> and <WG2532> exhort <WG3870> and <WG2532> reprove <WG1651> with <WG3326> all <WG3956> authority <WG2003>. Let <WG4065> no man <WG3367> despise <WG4065> thee <WG4675>.
